history.content:
"EECS made a decision a couple years ago, that once a student had completed all their EECS requirements, they didn’t have to take 2 technical courses a semester. The logic behind the decision was:

1)     EECS classes are impacted so we don’t want to force students who are done with their major requirements to take classes they wouldn’t otherwise choose to enroll in. We have hundreds of people who want to take the classes and seats should go to people who actually need or want to take the class.

2)     EECS would like students to be able to use their free electives to take whatever they want."

Mary Howell, Director of Advising for CoE
If it's the last semester and only one technical is required for degree completion?
history.subject: Do EECS seniors need 2 technicals?
